sentences: Carasaus (fl. c.  1240–60) was a French trouvère, five of whose works survive.

His career can be dated because he dedicates two grand chants (Fine amours m'envoie and Puis que j'ai chançon meüe) to Jehan de Dampierre (died 1259) and another (N'est pas sage qui me tourne a folie) to Henry III of Brabant (reigned 1248–61).
Besides Fine amours, which has pentasyllables, all of Carasaus's works have only heptasyllables and decasyllables.
